input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: HPSCActor.

The items for the adapter request. This should be an XML document with a root element named "items" having a child "item", which should contain the data necessary to execute the specific request.
Update Computer
This wrapper updates computer record via the application. The application saves this record into its repository which can later be used.
Sample Item Xml:
<items> <item> <operation-name>update-computer</operation-name> <model> <keys> <configuration-item> <value>MyComuter13</value> <type>String</type> </configuration-item>
</keys> <instance> <device> <type>Structure</type> <configuration-item> <value>MyComuter13</value> <type>String</type> </configuration-item> <vendor> <value>vendor-updated</value> <type>String</type> </vendor> <model> <value>model</value> <type>String</type> </model> <serial-number> <value>serial Number</value> <type>String</type> </serial-number> <location> <value>location</value> <type>String</type> </location> <configuration-item-type> <value>computer</value> <type>String</type> </configuration-item-type> <updated-by> <value>falcon</value> <type>String</type> </updated-by> <contact-name> <value>contact name</value> <type>String</type> </contact-name> <part-number> <value>part number</value> <type>String</type> </part-number> <status> <value>Installed</value> <type>String</type> </status> <configuration-item-sub-type> <value>Desktop</value> <type>String</type> </configuration-item-sub-type> <location-code> <value>Location</value> <type>String</type> </location-code> <building> <value>building</value> <type>String</type> </building> <floor> <value>floor</value> <type>String</type> </floor> <room> <value>room</value> <type>String</type> </room> <system-down> <!--value must be present--> <value>true</value> <type>boolean</type> </system-down> <asset-tag> <value>a</value> <type>String</type> </asset-tag> <critical> <!--value must be present--> <value>true</value> <type>boolean</type> </critical> <company> <value>ACME</value> <type>String</type> </company> <department> <value>Administration</value> <type>String</type> </department> <assignment-group> <value>assignment group</value> <type>String</type> </assignment-group> <addl> <type>array</type> <addl> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <type>structure</type> <addl-manufacturer> <value>addl maufacturer</value> <type>String</type> </addl-manufacturer> <addl-name> <value>addl name</value> <type>String</type> </addl-name> <addl-type> <value>addl type</value> <type>String</type> </addl-type> <addl-description> <value>addl description</value> <type>String</type> </addl-description> </element> </addl> </addl> <scans> <type>array</type> <scans> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <type>structure</type> <scan-date> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </scan-date> <scan-type> <value>scran type</value> <type>String</type> </scan-type> <scan-version> <value>scran version</value> <type>String</type> </scan-version> <scan-result> <value>scran result</value> <type>String</type> </scan-result> </element> </scans> </scans> <support-contacts> <type>array</type> <support-contacts> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <type>structure</type> <support-contact-name> <value>supoort contact name</value> <type>String</type> </support-contact-name> <support-contact-reason> <value>suport contact reason</value> <type>String</type> </support-contact-reason> <support-contact-first> <value>suport contact first</value> <type>String</type> </support-contact-first> <support-contact-last> <value>support contact last</value> <type>String</type> </support-contact-last> <support-contact-phone> <value>support contact phone</value> <type>String</type> </support-contact-phone> <support-contact-email> <value>supooet contact email</value> <type>String</type> <type>String</type> </feature-description> </element> </features> </features> </device> <computer> <type>structure</type> <configuration-item> <value>MyComputer13</value> <type>String</type> <value>1024</value> <type>String</type> </vid-resolution-x> <vid-resolution-y> <value>768</value> <type>String</type> </vid-resolution-y> </element> </video> </video> <processors> <type>array</type> <processors> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <type>Structure</type> <processor-id> <value>processor id</value> <type>String</type> </processor-id> <processor-name> <value>processor model</value> <type>String</type> </processor-model> <processor-max-speed> <value>100</value> <type>decimal</type> </processor-max-speed> </element> </processors> </processors> <connections> <type>array</type> <connections> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <type>Structure</type> <connection-name> <value>connection name</value> <type>String</type> </connection-name> <connection-type> <value>connection type</value> <type>String</type> </connection-type> <connection-ip-address> <value>connection ip address</value> <type>String</type> </connection-ip-address> <connection-mac-address> <value>connection mac address</value> <type>String</type> </connection-mac-address> <connection-domain-suffix> <value>connectino domain suffix</value> <type>String</type> </connection-domain-suffix> <connection-default-gateway> <value>connection default gateway</value> <type>String</type> </connection-default-gateway> <connection-subnet-mask> <value>connection subnet mask</value> <type>String</type> </connection-subnet-mask> <connection-device-id> <value>connection device id</value> <type>String</type> </connection-device-id> <connection-dhcp> <!--value must be present--> <value>true</value> <type>boolean</type> </connection-dhcp> <connection-description> <value>connection description</value> <type>String</type> </connection-description> <connection-speed> <value>100</value> <type>decimal</type> </connection-speed> <connection-media-interface> <value>2</value> <type>decimal</type> </connection-media-interface> </element> </connections> </connections> <value>port label</value> <type>String</type> </port-label> <port-connectivity> <value>port connectivity</value> <type>String</type> </port-connectivity> </element> </ports> </ports> <drivers> <type>array</type> <drivers> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <type>structure</type> <driver-name> <value>driver name</value> <type>String</type> </driver-name> <driver-type> <value>driver type</value> <type>String</type> </driver-type> <driver-description> <value>driver description</value> <type>String</type> </driver-description> <driver-version> <value>driver version</value> <type>String</type> </driver-version> </element> </drivers> </drivers> <pointing-devices> <type>array</type> <pointing-devices> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <type>structure</type> <point-manufacturer> <value>point manufacturer</value> <type>String</type> </point-manufacturer> <point-model> <value>point model</value> <type>String</type> </point-model> <point-type> <value>point type</value> <type>String</type> </point-type> <point-buttons> <value>2</value> <type>decimal</type> </point-buttons> <point-driver> <value>point driver</value> <type>String</type> </point-driver> </element> </pointing-devices> </pointing-devices> <keyboards> <type>array</type> <keyboards> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <type>structure</type> <keyboard-manufacturer> <value>keyboard manufacturer</value> <type>String</type> </keyboard-manufacturer> <keyboard-model> <value>keyboard model</value> <type>String</type> </keyboard-model> <keyboard-type> <value>keyboard type</value> <type>String</type> </keyboard-type> <keyboard-connection> <value>keyboard connection</value> <type>String</type> </keyboard-connection> <keyboard-features> <value>keyboard feature</value> <type>String</type> </keyboard-features> </element> </keyboards> </keyboards> <usb> <type>array</type> <usb> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <type>structure</type> <usb-manufacturer> <value>usb manufacturer</value> <type>String</type> </usb-manufacturer> <usb-model> <value>usb model</value> <type>String</type> </usb-model> <usb-type> <value>usb type</value> <type>String</type> </usb-type> <usb-version> <value>usb version</value> <type>String</type> </usb-version> <usb-class> <value>usb class</value> <type>String</type> </usb-class> <usb-ports> <value>4</value> <type>decimal</type> </usb-ports> <usb-speed> <value>2</value> <type>decimal</type> </usb-speed> <usb-controller> <value>usb controller</value> <type>String</type> </usb-controller> </element> </usb> </usb> <physical-drives> <type>array</type> <physical-drives> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <type>strcuture</type> <physical-id> <value>physical id</value> <type>String</type> </physical-id> <physical-manufacturer> <value>physical manufacturer</value> <type>String</type> </physical-manufacturer> <physical-model> <value>physical model</value> <type>String</type> </physical-model> <physical-type> <value>physical type</value> <type>String</type> </physical-type> <physical-sectors> <value>2</value> <type>decimal</type> </physical-sectors> <physical-heads> <value>2</value> <type>decimal</type> </physical-heads> <physical-cylinders> <value>3</value> <type>decimal</type> </physical-cylinders> <physical-size> <value>120</value> <type>decimal</type> </physical-size> <physical-serial-number> <value>1212</value> <type>decimal</type> </physical-serial-number> </element> </physical-drives> </physical-drives> <logical-drives> <type>array</type> <logical-drives> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <type>structure</type> <logical-drive-name> <value>logical drive name</value> <type>String</type> </logical-drive-name> <logical-media> <value>logical media</value> <type>String</type> </logical-media> <logical-free-space> <value>100</value> <type>decimal</type> </logical-free-space> <logical-volume-type> <value>logical volume type</value> <type>String</type> </logical-volume-type> <logical-volume-size> <value>100</value> <type>decimal</type> </logical-volume-size> </element> </logical-drives> </logical-drives> <OSName> <value>osName</value> <type>String</type> </OSName> <OSVersion> <value>os version</value> <type>String</type> </OSVersion> <BIOSID> <value>bios id</value> <type>String</type> </BIOSID> <BIOSManufacturer> <value>bios manufacturer</value> <type>String</type> </BIOSManufacturer> <BIOSModel> <value>bios model</value> <type>String</type> </BIOSModel> <total-physical-memory> <value>1000</value> <type>decimal</type> </total-physical-memory> <sysmodtime> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </sysmodtime> <sysmoduser> <value>falcon</value> <type>String</type> </sysmoduser> <sysmodcount> <value>2</value> <type>decimal</type> </sysmodcount> <o-s-name> <value>o s name</value> <type>String</type> </o-s-name> <o-s-version> <value>o s version</value> <type>String</type> </o-s-version> <b-i-o-s-i-d> <value>b i o s i d</value> <type>String</type> </b-i-o-s-i-d> <b-i-o-s-manufacturer> <value>b i o s manufacturer</value> <type>String</type> </b-i-o-s-manufacturer> <b-i-o-s-model> <value>b i o s model</value> <type>String</type> </b-i-o-s-model> </computer> </instance> </model> </item> </items> Elements’ Description: Update Process takes place in following manner-
The record is first selected (located) by the information provided in the <keys> element. Essentially, you populate <keys> element with valid key elements otherwise the record wouldn’t be located.
Once the record is located properly, the fields are updated by the information provided in <instance> element. That is, the respective fields of located record are replaced by the elements’ values that are provided in <instance> element.
NOTE: While locating a record, complete matching of key is required. This means if you give key value to be “abc” and there is a record in the application repository which has key element as “abc123” then this record wouldn’t be located for the update (compare with Find Wrappers.)
Modification/Update in located record is done in following manner-
Suppose an random element with name <random-element> which has an 'fieldValue1'. i.e. on retrieving, we'll get.
<instance> ... ...
<random-element> <value>fieldValue1</value> <type>fieldType<type> </random-element> ... ... </instance>
Now see following cases of updation-
Case-1: <instance> </instance>
i.e., we don't provide even the element <random-element> Result: the field get ignored, i.e. not updated.
Case-2: <instance> <random-element> <value></value> <type>fieldType<type> </random-element> </instance>
i.e., we don't provide anything inside <value> element (child of element <random-element>.) Result: the field get ignored, i.e. not updated.
Case-3: <instance> <random-element> <value> </value> <type>fieldType<type> </random-element> </instance>
i.e., we provide an space character " " (or more contiguous space characters, like " ") inside <value> element (child of element <random-element>.) Result: the field get's updated, and the field <random-elements> is set to blank ""(compare with space character " ".)
Case-4: <instance> <random-element> <value>fieldValue2</value> <type>fieldType<type> </random-element> </instance>
i.e., we provide "fieldValue2" inside <value> element (child of element <random-element>.) Result: the value "fieldValue2" is set to field of <random-element>.
NOTE: One can update the key elements too.
Complete Elements’ Description:
item [Required]: This is a child of <items>. This <item> tag can be multiple times to support "multiple items support".
operation-name [Required]:
This shows, what operation you want to perform.
Valid values: <operation-name>update-computer</operation-name> is valid operation name element.
keys [Required]: used to ask application to search for the record with the elements inside it.
Instance [Required] : It can have many children. The children of this element describe fields of a record.
Device [Required]: Children of it holds the information about the record.
configuration-item [Required]: This is the name of the record. It must be unique as it’s used as key as well.
Name of this element in the application: “System Summary > Configuration Item.”
Valid Values: Any unique string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Vendor [Optional]: The vendor name.
Name of this element in the application: “Vendor > Vendor Name.”
Valid Values: Any string or you can select vendor record from the application’s repository.
Default Value: Ignored.
Model [Optional]: Model of part selected (in the element part number)
Name of this element in the application: System Summary > Model.
Valid Values: Any string.
Serial-number [Optional]: The serial number of the record.
Name of this element in the application: “System Summary > Serial Number.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Location [Optional]: location mapped by the record.
Name of this element in the application: “Location > Location.”
Valid Values: Any String or you can select any existing location record.
Default Value:Ignored
Configuration-item-type[Required]: the type of the configuration item.
Name of this element in the application: When we create any configuration item then at beginning level we’re asked for the type of configuration item. We have to select one of them. Like if we want to create display device then we should select that one. Other example might be computer, telecommunication device etc.
Also note that, these subtype are customizable. You can create new configuration item type in through the application.
Valid Values: Computer.
Default Value:Ignored
Updated-by [Optional] : the name of the person that has updated the record.
Name of this element in the record: This is hidden field maintained by the record and is not visible to the application’s graphical interface. It has no use in the creation of the record process, but we can use this field during retrieving process.
Valid Values: Any string (during retrieving.)
Default Value: This field is maintained by the application, user need not to give this input. The application inserts the user-name who is using the web-service.
Contact-name [Optional]: the contact name.
Name of this element in the record: “Contact > Contact Name.”
Valid Value: Any string, or you can select any existing contact record.
Default Value:Ignored
Part-number [Optional]: the part number.
Name of this element in the record: “System Summary > Part Number”
Valid Values: Any string, or you can select any existing contact record.
Default Value:Ignored
Status[Optional] : the status of the configuration item.
Name of this element in the application: “System Summary > Status”
Valid Values: Any one string out of following set of strings
Installed Available Warehouse Transfer RMA Replaced Reserved Retired
Default Value:Ignored
configuration-item-sub-type [Optional] : The subtype for a selected configuration item type.
Name of this element in the application: “System Summary > Subtype.”
Valid Values: this is customizable and we can add/delete more subtypes. Currently there are following subtypes for the “computer” configuration item type.
Desktop Dumb Terminal Laptop Tower Mac Server
Default Value: Desktop.
location-code [Optional]: location-code field of location selected (Location > Location)
Name of this element in the application: Hidden (a hidden field of location record selected)
Valid Values: Any string.
Building[Optional] : the building information (an information related to the location) for the record.
Name of this element in the record: “Location > Building.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Floor [optional]: the floor information (an information related to the location.)
Name of this element in the record: “Location > Floor.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Asset-tag [Optional]: the asset tag for the record.
Name of this element in the record: “System Summary > Asset Tag.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Critical[Optional]: this tell whether the record is critical or not.
Name of this element in the record: System Summary > radio button call “Critical CI”.
Valid Values: true/ false.
True -> record is critical. False -> record is not critical.
Default value: false.
company [Optional]: company field of contact selected. (Contact > Contact Name)
Name of this elment in the application: Contact > Company.
Valid Values: Any string.
Department[Optional]: the department information.
Name of this element in the record: “System Summary > Department.”
Valid Value: any string, or you can select any existing record from the application.
Default Value:Ignored
Assignment-group[Optional]: the assignment group.
Name of this element in the record: “System Summary > Assignment.”
Valid Value: Any string, or you can select any existing record from the application.
Default Value:Ignored
Addl[Optional]: The children of this elements keep information of other (additional) components.
Name of this element in the record: “Components > Additional”
Valid Values: as it’s array type, it must be structure in following manner-
<addl> <type>array</type> <addl> <!— children keeps information > </addl> </addl>
Default Value: in case we leave this element blank, all the fields which are successor to this would be keep blank.
Addl > addl [Optional] : information for additional component.
Name of this element in the record: “components > Additional.”
Valid Values: this element has many children each must have name <element> (except metadata element <type>) otherwise they will simply be ignored during creation of the record process.
Default Value: In case we leave this element blank, all the fields which are successor of it would be kept blank.
Addl-manufacturer[optional] : The name of manufacturer who had made the additional component.
Name of this element in the record: “Components > Additional > Manufacturer.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Addl-name [Optional] : the name of additional component.
Name of this element in the record: “Components > Additional > Name”
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Addl-type [Optional]: the type of additional component.
Name of this element in the record: “Components > Additional > Type.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Addl-description[Optional] : the description of the additional component.
Name of this element in the record: “Components > Additional > Description.”
Valid Value: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Scans [Optional: It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional] : It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
NOTE: each element show one row.
Scan-date [Optional] : The scan date.
Name of this element in the application: “Scanner > Date”
Valid Values: Any input in DateTime format.
Default Value:Ignored
Scan-type [Optional] : the type of scan.
Name of this element in the application: “Scanner > type.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Scan-version: The version information of the scanner.
Name of this element in the application: “Scanner > version.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Values: “”
Scan-result[Optional]: The scan result.
Name of this element in the application: “Scanner > Scan Result.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored.
Support-contacts [Optional]: : It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional] : It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Note: each element <element> shows one row in the application.
support-contact-name [Optional] : The name of support contact.
Name of this element in the application: “Contact > Contact Name.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored.
Support-contact-reason [Optional] : the reason field in the contact.
Name of this element in the application: “Contact > reason.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Support-contact-first [Optional] : A field for contact information.
Name of this element in the application: “Contact > First Name.”
Valid Value: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Support-contact-last [Optional]: A filed for contact information.
Name of this element in the application: “Contact > Last Name.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Support-contact-phone [Optional]: the phone number for the contact.
Name of this element in the application: “Contact > Phone No.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Support-contact-email [Optional]: the email id information for the contact.
Name of this field in the application: “Contact > E-mail.”
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “’
Feature [Optional] : It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional] : It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Note: each element <element> shows one row in the application.
Feature-id [optional]: the feature id.
Name of this field in the application: the field seems to be either non-existing or hidden.
Valid Value: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Feature-size [optional]: feature size.
Name of this field in the application: The field seems to be either non-existing or hidden.
Valid Value: Any decimal value.
Default Value:Ignored
Feature-description [optional]: the description of the feature.
Name of this element in the application: the field seems to be either non-existing or hidden.
Valid Value: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Computer [Required]: It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Configuration-item [Optional]: see conguration-item give above.
Printers[Optional] : It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional] : It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Note: each element <element> shows one row in the application.
Printer-server-name [Optional]: the name of printer server.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Printing > Server Name.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Printer-manufacturer [Optional] : the name of printer manufacturer.
Name of this field in the application: Components > Printing > Manufacturer.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Printer-model [Optional] : the model of printer.
Name of this field in the application: Components > Printing > Model.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Printer-driver-name [Optional]: the name of driver of printer.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Printing > Driver Name.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Printer-driver-version [Optional]: the version of the printer.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Printing > Driver Version.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Vid-card-id [Optional]: the video card id.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Video > Card ID
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Vid-card-bios [Optional]: the video card bios.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Video > Card Bios.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Vid-manufacturer [Optional]: the manufacturer name of the video.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Video > Manufacturer.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Vid-model[Optional]: the model of video card bios.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Video > Model
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Vid-chip-type [Optional]: the video chip type.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Video > Chip Type.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Vid-memory [Optional]: the video card memory.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Video > Memory (Kb)
Valid Values: Any decimal value.
Default Value:Ignored
Vid-resolution [Optional]: The resolution information of the screen.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Video > Resolution.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored.
Vid-resolution-x [Optional]: the number of pixels in x – axis.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Video > X Resolution.
Valid Values: Any decimal value, or more precisely natural number.
Default Value:Ignored
Vid-resolution-y [Optional]: the number of pixels in the y-axis.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Video > Y Resolution.
Valid Values: Any decimal Value, or more precisely natural number.
Default Value:Ignored
Processors[Optional]: the information about the processor. It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional] : It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Note: each element <element> shows one row in the application.
Processor-id [Optional]: the id of processor.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Processors > ID.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Processor-name[Optional]: the name of the processor.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Processors > Name.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Processor-manufacturer[Optional]: the name of processor manufacturer.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Processors > Manufacturer.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Processor-model[Optional]: The model of the processor.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Processors > Model.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
processor-max-speed[Optional]: The max speed of the processors in mega hertz.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Processors > Max Speed (MHz).
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Connections [Optional]: The connection information. It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional] : It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Note: each element <element> shows one row in the application.
Connection-name[Optional]: the name of connection.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Connections > Name.
Valid Value: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Connection-type[Optional]: the connection type.
Name of this elemnt in the application: Components > Connections > Type.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “’
Connection-ip-address[Optional]: the ip address of the for the connection.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Connections > IP Address.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “’
Connection-mac-address[Optional]: the mac address.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Connections > MAC Address.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Connection-domain-suffix[Optional]: The domain name suffix.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Connections > Domain Suffix.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default value: “’
Connection-default-gateway[Optional]: The default Gateway.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Connections > Default Gateway.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “’
Connection-subnet-mask[Optional]: the subnet mask.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Connections > Subnet Mask.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Connection-device-id[Optional]: The id of device.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Connections > Device ID.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “’
connection-dhcp [Optional] : tell whether dhcp is enabled or not.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Connections > DHCP Enabled.
Valid Values: true/false (any value other than true/false would be treated as default value of the element.). True -> DHCP is enabled. False -> DHCP is not enabled.
Default Value: false, i.e., DHCP is not enabled.
Connection-description[Optional]: Connection Description.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Connections > Description.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored.
Connection-speed[Optional]: the speed of the connection in Kbps (kilo bits per second)
Name of this element in the application: Components > Connections > Speed (Kbps)
Valid Values: Any decimal value, or more precisely natural number.
Default Value:Ignored
Connection-media-interface[Optional]: number of media interfaces.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Connections > Media Interfaces.
Valid Values: Any decimal value, or more precisely natural number.
Default Value: “’
Ports[Optional]: It holds port information. It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional] : It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Note: each element <element> shows one row in the application.
Port-name[Optional]: The name of the port.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Ports > Name.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Port-level[Optional]: Level to the port.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Ports > Label.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Port-connectivity [Optional]: the connectivity information (serial or parallel).
Name of this element in the application: Components > Ports > Parallel/Serial.
Valid Values: Ideally it should have been value either parallel or serial, but however, you can put any string to it. Like “xyz123.”
Default Value:Ignored
Drivers[Optional] : It hold driver related information. It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional] : It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Note: each element <element> shows one row in the application.
Driver-name[Optional]: the name of the driver.
Name of this element in the application: Software > Drivers > Name.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Driver-type[Optional]: The type of the driver.
Name of this element in the application: Software > Drivers > Type.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Driver-description[Optional]: Description related to driver.
Name of this element in the application: Software > Drivers > Description.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Driver-version[Optional]: The version of the driver.
Name of this element in the application: Software > Drivers > Version.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored.
pointing-devices[Optional]: Holds information of pointing components. It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional] : It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Note: each element <element> shows one row in the application.
point-manufacturer[Optional]: the name of manufacturer.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Pointing Devices > Manufacturer.
Valid Values: Any String.
Default Values: “”
point-model [Optional]: the pointing device model.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Pointing Devices > Model.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
point-type [Optional]: The type of pointing device.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Pointing Devices > Type.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored.
point-button [Optional]: Number of buttons in the pointing device.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Pointing Devices > Buttons.
Valid Values: Any decimal value, or more precisely natural number. Default Value:Ignored.
point-driver[Optional]: The Driver of the pointing device.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Pointing Devices > Drivers.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored.
Keyboards [Optional]: Holds the keyboards information. It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional] : It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Note: each element <element> shows one row in the application.
Keyboard-manufacturer [Optional]: The manufacturer name of the keyboard.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Keyboards > Manufacturer.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Keyboard-model [Optional]: the model of the keyboard.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Keyboards > Model.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored.
Keyboard-type [Optional]: The type of keyboard.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Keyboards > type.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
keyboard-connection [Optional]: they connection information for the keyboard.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Keyboards > Connection.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Keyboard-feature [Optional]: Any feature of the keyboard should be included in it.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Keyboards > Features.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Usb[Optional]: Hold the information of usb. It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional] : It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Note: each element <element> shows one row in the application.
Usb-manufacturer [Optional]: the usb manufacturer.
Name of this element in the application: Components > USB > Manufacturer.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Usb-model [Optional]: the model of the usb.
Name of this element in the application: Compoents > USB > Model.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Usb-type [Optional]: the type of USB.
Name of this element in the application: Components > USB > Type.
Valid Value: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Usb-version [Optional]: the version of the USB.
Name of this element in the application: Components > USB > Type.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored.
Usb-class [Optional]: the class of USB.
Name of this element in the application: Components > USB > Class.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored.
Usb-ports [Optional]: Number of ports at USB.
Name of this element in the applications: Components > USB > Ports.
Valid Values: Any decimal value, or more precisely natural numbers.
Default Value:Ignored
Usb-speed [Optional]: The speed of USB in Mbps (Mega bits per second.)
Name of this element in the application: Components > USB > Speed (Mbps.)
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored.
Usb-controller [Optional]: the controller to the usb.
Name of this element in the application: Components > USB > Controller.
physical-drives [Optional]: Holds information of physical drives. It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional] : It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Note: each element <element> shows one row in the application.
Physical-id [Optional]: The id of physical drive.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Physical Drives > ID.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Physical-manufacturer [Optional]: the name of manufacturer of physical drives.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Physical Drives > Manufacturer.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored.
Physical-model [Optional]: the model of physical drive.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Physical Drives > Model.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored.
Physical-type [Optional]: the type of physical drive.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Physical Drives > Type.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored.
Physical-sectors [Optional]: Number of sectors in the physical drive.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Physical Drives > Sectors.
Valid Values: Any decimal Value, or more precisely natural number.
Default Value:Ignored”.
Physical-heads [Optional]: Number of heads in the physical drives.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Physical Drives > Heads.
Valid Values: Any decimal value, or more precisely natural number.
Default Value:Ignored
Physical-cylinders [Optional]: Number of cylinders in the physical drive.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Physical Drives > Cylinders.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored.
Physical-size [Optional]: The memory capacity of the physical drive in Gb (Giga bits)
Name of this element in the application: Components > Physical Drives > Max Size (Gb)
Valid Values: Any decimal value.
Default Value:Ignored.
Physical-serial-number [Optional]: the serial number of the physical drive.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Physical Drives > Serial Number.
Valid Values: Any decimal value.
Default Value:Ignored
logical-drives[Optional] : Holds information of logical drives (virtual drives.) It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional] : It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type-element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Note: each element <element> shows one row in the application.
Logical-drive-name [Optional]: Name of the logical dirve.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Logical Drives > Name.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Logical-media[Optional]: The media info for the logical drive.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Logical Drives > Media.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored.
Logical-free-space [Optional]: Free space information for the logical drive in Gb (Giga Bits)
Name of this element in the application: Components > Logical Drives > Free Space (Gb)
Valid Values: Any decimal value.
Valid Value: “”.
Logical-volume-type [Optional]: The type of the logical drive.
Name of this element in the application: Components > Logical Drives > Type.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored
Logical-volume-size [Optional]: The capacity of the logical drive in Gb (Giga Bits.)
Name of this element in the application: Components > Logical Drives > Volume Size (Gb)
Valid Values: Any decimal value.
Default Value:Ignored.
OSName [Optional] : the name of operating system.
Name of this element in the application: This field seems to be wrongly referring to same field that is also referred by <o-s-name> element with-
Only read permission, and not write permission.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored.
OSVersion [Optional] : The version of operating system.
Name of this element in the application: : This field seems to be wrongly referring to same field that is also referred by <o-s-version> element with-
Only read permission, and not write permission.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored.
BIOSID [Optional] : ID to BIOS.
Name of this element in the application: This field seems to be hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Not known.
BIOSManufacturer [Optional] : the manufacturer of the BIOS.
Name of this element in the application: this field seems to be hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Not known.
BIOSModel [Optional] : The model of the BIOS.
Name of this element in the application: this field seems to be hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Not Known.
total-physical-memory[Optional] : Total physical memory.
Name of this element in the application: this field seems to be hidden.
Valid Values: Any decimal value.
Default Value: Not known.
Sysmodtime [Optional]: The system time.
Name of this element in the application: This field seems to be hidden.
Valid Values: Any input in DateTime format.
Default Value: Not known.
Sysmoduser [Optional]: (Not Writable) The system user.
Name of this element in the application: This field seems to hidden.
Valid Value: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored.
Sysmodcount [Optional]: some count.
Name of this element in the application: This field seems to be hidden.
Valid Values: Any decimal value, or more precisely natural number.
Default Value:Ignored.
o-s-name [Optional]: the name of operating system.
Name of this element in the application: System Summary > OS Name.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored.
o-s-version[Optional]: The version of operating system.
Name of this element in the application: System Summary > OS Version.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored.
b-i-o-s-i-d[Optional]: The bios id.
Name of this field in the application: System Summary > Bios ID.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored.
b-i-o-s-manufacturer [Optional]: The manufacturer of the BIOS.
Name of this element in the application: System Summary > Bios Manufacturer.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored.
b-i-o-s-model [Optional] : The model of BIOS.
Name of this element in the application: System Summary > Bios Model.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value:Ignored.

Provide username/password in form of xml.
This input parameter is required when the user wants to override the default values for username and password provided in the adapter configuration. This is required for cases where an operation cannot be executed with the default username/password provided in the adapter configuration and only user with special permissions can execute the operation. Examples of such operations can be - 'approve-change', 'deny-change', 'close-change', 'approve-task'
Sample XML Format:
<connection-parameters> <alternate-username>USERNAME</alternate-username> <alternate-password>PASSWORD</alternate-password> </connection-parameters>

output.description: The adapter response containing the results.

documentation.description:
Update Computer
This wrapper updates computer record via the application. The application saves this record into its repository which can later be used.
